definition.name: NXcg_primitive

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: d
symbol.doc: The dimensionality of the embedding space.

symbol.name: c
symbol.doc: The cardinality of the set, i.e. the number of members.

definition.doc:
Computational geometry description of a set of primitives in Euclidean space.
Primitives must neither be degenerated nor self-intersect. Individual primitives can differ in their properties (e.g. size, shape, rotation).

field.name: depends_on
field.doc: Reference to an instance of :ref:`NXcoordinate_system` in which these primitives are defined.

field.name: dimensionality
field.doc: The dimensionality of the primitive set.

field.name: cardinality
field.doc: The cardinality of the primitive set.

field.name: identifier_offset
field.doc:
Integer offset whereby the identifier of the first member of the set differs from zero.
Identifiers can be defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing identifiers are defined on the interval :math:`[identifier\_offset, identifier\_offset + c - 1]`.
Therefore, implicit identifier are completely defined by the value of identifier_offset and cardinality. For example if identifier run from -2 to 3 the value for identifier_offset is -2.
For explicit indexing the field identifier has to be used. Fortran-/Matlab- and C-/Python-style indexing have specific implicit identifier conventions where identifier_offset is 1 and 0 respectively.

field.name: identifier
field.doc: Identifier of each member for explicit indexing.

field.name: center
field.doc: The center of mass position of each primitive.

field.name: is_center_of_mass
field.doc: True if the center is a center of mass.

field.name: shape
field.doc: A qualitative description of the shape of each primitive.

field.name: length
field.doc:
Qualifier for the length of characteristic features of the primitive.
Often the term length is associated with the assumption that one edge is parallel to an axis of the coordinate system.

field.name: width
field.doc: Qualifier often used to describe the length of one characteristic edge within the coordinate system.

field.name: is_closed
field.doc: True if primitive is closed such that it has properties like area or volume.

field.name: volume
field.doc:
Volume of each primitive.
Set to NaN if does not apply for primitives for which is_closed is False.

field.name: area
field.doc:
Alias for surface_area of each primitive.
Set to NaN if does not apply for primitives for which is_closed is False.

field.name: orientation
field.doc:
Direction unit vector which points along the longest principal axis of each primitive.
Use the depends_on attribute to specify in which coordinate system these direction unit vectors are defined.
